meanings.definition: Look quickly and furtively at something.
meanings.sent1: She peeped through the keyhole to see who was outside.
meanings.sent2: The curious child peeped over the fence to catch a glimpse of the puppies.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat peeped around the corner before pouncing on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The detective peeped into the suspect's alibi to find any inconsistencies.
meanings.sent5: The little bird peeped out of its nest for the first time, hesitant but curious.

meanings.sent1: The baby bird peeped loudly for its mother to bring food.
meanings.sent2: The chicks peeped softly in the nest, waiting for their mother to return.
meanings.sent3: The kitten peeped in protest when the bathwater touched its paws.
meanings.sent4: The old door peeped in complaint as it swung open on its rusty hinges.
meanings.sent5: The mouse peeped in fear as the cat approached, hoping to remain unnoticed.

meanings.sent1: The tired puppy peeped as it tried to keep up with the energetic pack.
meanings.sent2: The injured bird peeped softly, seeking comfort from its mate.
meanings.sent3: The lost kitten peeped pitifully, hoping to be found by its owner.
meanings.sent4: The old toy peeped sadly as the child accidentally stepped on it.
meanings.sent5: The tiny mouse peeped in delight as it found a hidden stash of cheese.
